perturbation.original_text:
1.10. IMPRESSE SITE shall mean the Site located at www.impresse.com (and any successor Site thereto).

1.19. SITE shall mean a site located on the World Wide Web portion of the Internet.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.10. IMPRESSE SITE shall mean the Platform located at www.impresse.com (and any successor Platform thereto).

1.19. SITE shall mean a site located on the World Wide Web portion of the Internet.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Site' in IMPRESSE SITE definition is replaced with 'Platform'. This creates ambiguity as to whether 'Impresse Site' still refers to a regular website or something broader, potentially affecting scope of obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 2.5. Impresse hereby grants to VerticalNet a non-exclusive, non-transferable, royalty-free, right and license to link to the Impresse Area of the Co-Branded Site. Impresse shall permit Users who access the Co-Branded Site to access and use Co-Branded Content from the Co-Branded Site for the personal use of such Users in accordance with the then-current terms of Impresse's standard license agreement governing the use of such Co-Branded Content.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.5. Impresse hereby grants to VerticalNet a non-exclusive, non-transferable, royalty-free, right and license to link to the Impresse Area of the Co-Branded Online Space. Impresse shall permit Users who access the Co-Branded Site to access and use Co-Branded Content from the Co-Branded Site for the personal use of such Users in accordance with the then-current terms of Impresse's standard license agreement governing the use of such Co-Branded Content.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Site' is changed to 'Online Space'. It is unclear whether 'Impresse Area' definition includes all contents present within the Co-Branded Site. Making it confusing, VerticalNet may think some features within Co-Branded Site are not under their licensing agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 10.1.1. Except for the express rights granted to Impresse under this Agreement, Impresse acknowledges and agrees that the Intellectual Property of VerticalNet is and shall remain the sole property of VerticalNet and nothing in this Agreement shall confer in Impresse any right of ownership or license rights in VerticalNet's Intellectual Property. In addition, Impresse shall not now or in the future contest the validity of VerticalNet's ownership of its Intellectual Property; provided, however, that Impresse may contest the validity of VerticalNet's Intellectual Property in any proceeding brought against Impresse alleging infringement or misappropriation of VerticalNet's Intellectual Property.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1.1. Except for the express rights granted to Impresse under this Agreement, Impresse acknowledges and agrees that the Intellectual Creation of VerticalNet is and shall remain the sole property of VerticalNet and nothing in this Agreement shall confer in Impresse any right of ownership or license rights in VerticalNet's Intellectual Creation. In addition, Impresse shall not now or in the future contest the validity of VerticalNet's ownership of its Intellectual Property; provided, however, that Impresse may contest the validity of VerticalNet's ownership of its Intellectual Property in any proceeding brought against Impresse alleging infringement or misappropriation of VerticalNet's Intellectual Property.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'Intellectual Property' to 'Intellectual Creation' in the first sentence, it becomes ambiguous what exactly VerticalNet owns. Does 'Intellectual Creation' encompass all aspects of 'Intellectual Property', or are there components not covered? This introduces uncertainty in ownership and licensing.
